answers.title: Total Revenue from Electronics Category in Q4 2024

student_answer.work_shown: I filtered the ecommerce_sales.csv for Electronics and counted up all the orders in October, November, and December. I got around $6,500.
student_answer.methodology_description: Filtered by category and date range

answers.title: Average Order Value for SAVE20 discount code

student_answer.work_shown: I found all orders with SAVE20 code and calculated the average price. Around 9-10 orders out of 30 had the discount, so about 30%.
student_answer.methodology_description: Filtered by discount code, calculated average

student_answer.work_shown: P890 had 1 return out of 5 orders = 20% return rate. This was higher than other products I checked.
The revenue went down each month in Q4.
student_answer.methodology_description: Summed revenue by month, calculated percentage changes

student_answer.work_shown: I counted the ages from the customer file and grouped them.
CLV = total_spent / total_orders = $4,500 / 20 = $225. This is the average value per order for customer C1042.
student_answer.methodology_description: Divided total spent by total orders

answers.title: Correlation between Age and Total Spent

student_answer.interpretation: This means there's a very strong positive correlation - older customers spend more.
student_answer.work_shown: Using Excel's CORREL function on the age and total_spent columns, I got 0.92.

student_answer.comparison: Treatment performed better by 45 percentage points
student_answer.work_shown: Control: 6 conversions / 20 users = 30%. Treatment: 15 conversions / 20 users = 75%. Difference: 75% - 30% = 45 percentage points. Treatment group converted much better!
student_answer.methodology_description: Calculated conversion rates for each group

student_answer.work_shown: The test had equal numbers in each group, so no balance issues.

student_answer.conclusion: Yes, this is statistically significant (p < 0.05). The difference between Control and Treatment is statistically significant, so we can conclude the treatment actually improved conversions.
student_answer.methodology_description: Performed chi-square test on contingency table
